meanings.definition: The act of soiling or making dirty.
meanings.sent1: The soilage of the carpet was evident from the muddy footprints.
meanings.sent2: Please clean up the soilage on the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's joyous soilage of the freshly washed clothes left his mother exasperated.
meanings.sent4: The soilage of lies tarnished his reputation beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The soilage of the once pristine forest saddened the environmentalists.

meanings.definition: Material that has been soiled or dirtied.
meanings.sent1: The janitor disposed of the soilage in the trash bin.
meanings.sent2: The laundry detergent effectively removed the soilage from the shirt.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dropped the cake, resulting in a messy soilage on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The soilage on the document made it difficult to read the important information.
meanings.sent5: The soilage on the painting diminished its beauty and value.
